title: Dhaka Capitals coach dies after collapsing ahead of BPL game
byline: Dhaka Capitals assistant coach Mahbub Ali Zaki died after collapsing suddenly at the Sylhet International Cricket Stadium during a Bangladesh Premier League match on Saturday.

title: At least 15 dead, 19 injured in Guatemala bus accident
byline: At least 15 people were killed and 19 injured after a passenger bus plunged into a ravine on the Inter-American Highway in western Guatemala, authorities said on Saturday.

title: 133 mobile phones seized at Boossa Prison in 2025
byline: Police have seized 133 mobile phones during 72 raids conducted at the Boossa High-Security Prison in 2025.

title: 62 dental surgeons to receive appointment letters on Monday
byline: Appointment letters for 62 Dental Surgeons will be handed over at a special ceremony at the main auditorium of the Ministry of Health and Mass Media on Monday (29) under the patronage of Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: NBRO clears Colombo–Kandy road at Pahala Kadugannawa
byline: The Colombo–Kandy main road at Pahala Kadugannawa has been reopened to traffic following the implementation of temporary safety measures after recent landslides, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) said.

title: Decision needed on landslide-risk schools in Central Province
byline: A decision must be taken regarding several schools in the Central Province that are at risk of landslides, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) said.

title: CSE warns investors not to trade through unauthorised applications
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has warned investors not to trade through unauthorised applications, warning that the BoMate App has fraudulently used the CSE logo.

title: Petrol bomb attack on night club thwarted, six arrested
byline: Six individuals who were planning to hail a petrol bomb at a nightclub in Seeduwa were arrested with six petrol bombs.

title: Zelensky plans to meet Trump on Sunday for talks on ending Russian war
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said he will meet his US counterpart Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday, as talks continue on ending Russia’s full-scale war.

title: Govt to provide Rs. 500,000 to cyclone-hit households without assessments
byline: The government will provide Rs. 500,000 to each household affected by the Ditwah cyclone without conducting individual damage assessments, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala said.

title: Showers expected in several areas; Public urged to take precautions
byline: A few showers are expected to occur in parts of the Northern, Eastern and Uva provinces, as well as in the Polonnaruwa, Matale and Nuwara Eliya districts, according to the latest weather forecast.

title: Cinnamon Grand Colombo issues clarification on ‘NE-YO Live in Sri Lanka’ concert
byline: Cinnamon Grand Colombo has issued a clarification addressing public concerns surrounding the cancelled or disrupted “NE-YO Live in Sri Lanka” concert, acknowledging the disappointment and frustration felt by fans who had eagerly anticipated the event.

title: Risk of Propofol shortage could disrupt major surgeries: Doctors Warn
byline:
There is a growing risk of a shortage of propofol infusion/injection, a key drug used for anesthesia in surgical procedures, Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance 
Chairman Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: Suppressing media is disaster: Wajira
byline: Suppressing the media is a disaster, United National Party (UNP) Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said today.

title: Fraud complaints lodged against Ne-Yo concert organizers
byline: Fraud complaints have been lodged with the Kollupitiya Police against the organizers of the Ne-Yo concert, Brown Boy Presents, following the abrupt postponement of the event originally scheduled for December 28, 2025.

title: Government bound to take action against publishing false, distorted news: Nalinda
byline: Claiming that the government will not resort to media suppression at any cost, Health and Mass Media Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today that the government is bound to take action against any media that spreads false and distorted news.

title: Douglas Devananda detained for 72 hours
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was arrested in connection with an investigation into a missing firearm, has been detained under a 72-hour detention order for further questioning.

title: Police respond to claims over Suriyakanda incident involving NPP MP
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have issued a further statement regarding the incident involving a police constable attached to the Suriyakanda Police Station and National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Shantha Padmakumara.

title: VIASL urges Government to revise taxes on small vehicles
byline: The Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) has called on the government to revise the pricing and tax structure for low engine-capacity vehicles to make them more affordable, particularly for middle-income consumers.

title: DMC prepares for predicted heavy rainfall from Monday
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) says it has taken necessary preparedness measures in view of a predicted increase in rainfall from the Monday (29), as forecast by the Meteorology Department.

title: Veteran singer Latha Walpola passes away at 92
byline: Veteran singer Ms. Latha Walpola has passed away this evening at the age of 92, family sources confirmed.
